message: So, what pulled you toward design in the first place?
I started in college noticing how small visual changes boosted engagement, like a 30% uptick in event attendance after rebranding one program, and that feedback loop hooked me.
And after school, how did things evolve?
I balanced retail and design by applying design principles daily, helping roughly 20 customers a day customize furniture while keeping turnaround times under 24 hours for digital consultations.
At Brightline, I worked on 6 brand identity projects end to end, and one campus campaign increased event signups by about 40% compared to the previous year.
Mostly Illustrator, InDesign, and Photoshop daily, plus Asana and Notion to track 10–15 concurrent tasks without missing deadlines.
How do you usually work with others?
I like quick check-ins and clear metrics, for example weekly reviews with 3–5 stakeholders to align goals and cut revision rounds by about half.
